column1: Guamúchil (Spanish pronunciation: [ɡwaˈmutʃil] gwa-MOO-chill) is a city located in the state of Sinaloa (Northern Mexico). It is 100 km north of Culiacán
column2: the capital of Sinaloa. The city serves as the municipal seat of the municipality of  Salvador Alvarado and is the center of a region called "valle del Évora"
column3: named after the Évora river. In 2020
column4: the city has a population of around 72
column5: 500 inhabitants. It is the fifth-largest city in the state in population after Culiacán

column1: Left top: the Mochomo mountain and the Evora River referring to its region
Left bottom: the primary elements used in commerce relating to politics
Right top: the pacific railroad track that initiated the communication for progress in that area
Right bottom: the chickpea as the main product in the region along with cheese and wool.
Center: a man with open arms towards progress.Overall Guamúchil has been one of the cities that generates the greatest progress to the state.
Guamúchil has a hot-type semi-arid or steppe climate (BSh) under the Köppen climate classification
column2: with a mean annual precipitation of 593 millimetres (23.3 in) and a mean annual temperature of 25.1 °C (77.2 °F).

column1: Trade is a very important part for the economy of this city. There are large grain storage warehouses for sale and use. Agriculture is one of the main sources of income in the area
column2: and different types of foods are grown but it is mainly corn and tomato.

column1: This city can produce more than 15 types of different crops. Many basic for Regional Agro-industry and for domestic and international markets
column9: fruits and grasses among other consumption.

column1: Guamúchil is the birthplace of boxer Carlos Cuadras
column3: and Miss México World 2009 Perla Beltrán.
